about_the_game:
Make your own music as Violin Prodigy, Maestro, The Guide, performs a medley of duets against six consecutive monstrous vessels corrupted by Kappellmeister, a villain of a bygone era long before Soli Kingdom. Your attacks sync with each boss theme, and creates an experience of truly performing a duel-of-duets with each one of them. Go forth then, rosin your bow, tune your magic violin, and free the orchestral family trapped within warped shells of themselves, tormented by a melody of past upsets and lifelong regrets. Are you ready? 'Cause chaos loves company... And yes, We Got Compagnie!

A Kingdom Of Corrupted Melody

From the dissonant Staccato Kingdom arose the Soli Kingdom like a symphony, after years of harmony thanks to the Prodigies appointed by the Conductor, she suddenly takes her leave confident in the leadership of this new Orchestral Family. However, a mysterious melody begins to corrupt the burrows and towns. Maestro the Violinist, a diplomat of the Orchestral Family returns to find the Kingdom corrupted. She now must face her friends, the corrupted Prodigies, and return Soli Kingdom to what it once was.

       

The samurai of musicians, the violinist with a flick of their wrist sounds a journey of a thousand clashing blades –harmonious to the innocent yet brutal to the Prodigies.

                              Play as the Violin Prodigy known as Maestro the Guide.

The Violin Prodigy, known as Maestro "The Guide", returns from a diplomatic mission to a home once glorious and beautiful...now bleak and hideous. She stands on the large stage of the Great Orchestral Hall with one mission in mind: to purify her home of this vile corruption, to save her fellow Prodigies, and to discover and put a stop to this "ghost" hiding deep within the shadows.

Perform your own melody through two different types of attacks:

  • Play quick and sharp pulses of musical notes with the flurry attack, to pierce though and drain away the corruption trapping the Prodigies.

  • Play broad yet brutal waves of musical notes with the beam attack, to deal tons of damage to the Corrupted Prodigies.

  • Dodge and weave through the Corrupted Prodigies attacks, through your efforts to rescue them.

                With not but a breath of air, roaring thunder shatters the opposition.

                                                Face the hefty Forte "The Strong":

Forte "The Strong" once served as the Orchestral Family's Tuba Prodigy as well as the General for the Brass Army. He was renowned for his strength, being regarded as the pillar holding up the Soli Kingdom and the Orchestral Family, Now, under the spell of the Corrupted Melody, he is but a corrupted shadow of his former self.

  • Forte will Ground Slam you if you get too close.

  • Forte will also Charge at you when he gets the chance. Think of a football player, you DO NOT want to be in his way.

  • Do not underestimate the sluggish wobble of Forte "The Strong." Forte gains distance through his Jump Slam attack with the help of his brass arms. Careful that you aren't underneath him when he lands!

  • When Forte is on the defense, he summons a shield, while shooting Corrupted Musical notes your way.

content_descriptors.notes: Some revealing clothing, and cartoon violence.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: OS X 10.11 (El Capitan)
  • Processor: Apple Silicon M1
  • Memory: 8 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Apple Silicon M1
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: macOS 13 (Ventura)
  • Processor: Apple Silicon M1 Pro
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Apple Silicon M1 Pro
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

name: We Got Compagnie!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GTX 1060 3GB
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • VR Support: No
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • VR Support: No

short_description: Ready your bow, tune your magical violin, and untangle musical vessels from a Corrupted Melody in duels-of-duets. Are you ready? 'Cause chaos loves company!... And yes, We Got Compagnie!
